text.text: What is the distinction between charge rates and allowable amounts in insurance contracts?

text: An insurance contract is an agreement with a payer for a dollar amount that the payer will reimburse your company for services, supplies, and procedures. This is different from charge rates. The amount that you enter in the allowable amounts section of the insurance record is the amount the insurance will pay you while the charge rate is the amount your company charges.

text.text: How are allowable amounts calculated for insurance contracts?

text: Allowable amounts can be calculated by the flat amount per HCPCS, % of Medicare fee schedule, or % of charge amount.

text.text: Where are allowable amounts configured for insurance contracts, and what are they associated with?

text: Allowable amounts are configured in Payers and are associated with the benefit plan for that payer.

text.text: When working a claim with a payer contract, how are universal charges applied, and what amount is expected from the payer?

text: When you work a claim where there is a contract with the payer, the universal charges are applied to the claim and sent to the clearinghouse. Because of the contractual amounts you entered for the benefit plan, the system knows that the amount you will receive from the payer will be the expected amount not the billed amount.

text.text: Where can you find the expected amount for a claim with a payer contract?

text: The expected amount displays on the Claim page under the "Expected amounts" tab.

text.text: What is a facility contract, and how does it differ from an insurance contract?

text: A facility contract is an agreement with a facility for a dollar amount that the facility will reimburse your company for services, supplies, and procedures. This is different from charge rates. The contracted facility amount is the amount the facility agreed to pay your company while the charge rate is the amount your company charges. An insurance contract is an agreement with a payer for a dollar amount that the payer will reimburse your company for services, supplies, and procedures. This is different from charge rates. The amount that you enter in the allowable amounts section of the insurance record is the amount the insurance will pay you while the charge rate is the amount your company charges.

text.text: Could you explain the purpose of a facility contract?

text: A facility contract is an agreement with a facility for a dollar amount that the facility will reimburse your company for services, supplies, and procedures. This is different from charge rates. The contracted facility amount is the amount the facility agreed to pay your company while the charge rate is the amount your company charges.

text.text: How are facility contracts associated with reimbursement for services and procedures?

text: A facility contract is an agreement with a facility for a dollar amount that the facility will reimburse your company for services, supplies, and procedures. This is different from charge rates. The contracted facility amount is the amount the facility agreed to pay your company while the charge rate is the amount your company charges.

text.text: Can you outline the steps to configure a payer contract in ZOLL Billing?

text:
To configure a payer contract in ZOLL Billing, follow these steps:

1. Go to the Payers page.
2. Click the New button.
3. Enter the payer name and other required information.
4. Click the Save button.
5. Click the Benefit Plans tab.
6. Click the New button.
7. Enter the benefit plan name and other required information.
8. Click the Save button.
9. Click the Allowable Amounts tab.
10. Click the Add button.
11. Select the HCPCS code.
12. Enter the allowable amount.
13. Click the Save button.
14. Repeat steps 10-13 for each HCPCS code that you have an allowable amount for.
15. Click the Close button.

text.text: What options are available for calculating allowable amounts in insurance contracts?

text: Allowable amounts can be calculated by the flat amount per HCPCS, % of Medicare fee schedule, or % of charge amount.

text.text: Is it possible to customize allowable amounts for different benefit plans within the same payer?

text: Yes, allowable amounts can be customized for different benefit plans within the same payer.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle the reconciliation between billed amounts and expected amounts in payer contracts?

text: Because of the contractual amounts you entered for the benefit plan, the system knows that the amount you will receive from the payer will be the expected amount not the billed amount. The expected amount displays on the Claim page under the "Expected amounts" tab.

text.text: Are facility contracts configured in the same way as insurance contracts in ZOLL Billing?

text: Facility contracts are configured in the same way as insurance contracts in ZOLL Billing.

A facility contract is an agreement with a facility for a dollar amount that the facility will reimburse your company for services, supplies, and procedures. This is different from charge rates. The contracted facility amount is the amount the facility agreed to pay your company while the charge rate is the amount your company charges.
